Hollande defeats Sarkozy in French presidential election

Francois Hollande won, making incumbent Nicolas Sarkozy the latest European official to be voted out following anger over economic policies. (AP, 6:19 p.m.)
  • Sarkozy joins fallen leaders amid Europe crisis
  • What's at stake as six European nations vote

FBI looking for bank-robbing woman

Officials said the woman, about 135 pounds and over 5 feet tall, has robbed five banks in Boston since last month, including three last Friday. (Globe, 6:30 p.m.)

Biden OK with married gay couple rights

Advocates said the Vice President's comments made him the highest-ranking member in the Obama administration to support gay marriage. (Globe, 3:54 p.m.)

Dos and don'ts for a workplace wardrobe

Get some practical -- but stylish -- work wardrobe advice from Ann Taylor Style Director Andrew Taylor and College Fashionista founder Amy Levin.

Police: Body at Derby track a homicide

The discovery at the Churchill Downs stables is being investigated as a homicide, but police said there is no connection to yesterday's Kentucky Derby. (AP, 3:19 p.m.)

Anger as families watch Sept. 11 hearing

Relatives of Sept. 11 victims reacted as the self-proclaimed mastermind of the Sept. 11 attacks tried to undermine his arraignment at Guantanamo Bay. (AP)
  • 9/11 defendants ignore judge at Guantanamo hearing
  • For 9/11 victims' families, hearing another ordeal

Airstrike kills senior al-Qaida leader in Yemen

Yemeni officials say an airstrike has killed a top al-Qaida leader who was wanted in the 2000 bombing of the USS Cole (pictured). The U.S. did not immediately confirm it.
